item.title: StarHub reintroduces 12GB mobile data bundles and additional features
item.description:
StarHub has introduced a new, budget-friendly package called SurfHub, combining mobile and home internet services. For a starting price of S$96.56 per month on a 24-month contract, SurfHub customers receive a 4G mobile plan with a minimum of 12GB of data and a 1Gbps fiber broadband connection for their homes. This combined offer costs roughly half the price of a standalone 12GB mobile plan. SurfHub also includes generous benefits like up to 700 minutes of local calls, 1,500 local SMS/MMS messages, and a subsidy for a new mobile phone...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/starhub-reintroduces-12gb-mobile-data-bundles-and-additional-features/

item.title: ViewQwest introduces new 2Gbps fiber broadband services
item.description:
Source: ViewQwest website. ViewQwest, a high-end internet provider in Singapore, has launched its 2Gbps fiber broadband service. ViewQwest’s CEO, Vignesa Moorthy, stated that the company recognizes the increasing demand for faster internet speeds as people use their home networks for data-intensive activities like streaming and working remotely. He emphasized the company’s commitment to delivering the fastest residential internet speeds globally and highlighted the easy setup process of their new 2Gbps service...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/viewqwest-introduces-new-2gbps-fiber-broadband-services/

item.title: Singtel increases maximum speeds for home office fibre broadband
item.description:
Singtel will launch a 10Gbps fiber broadband service for residential customers in Singapore this month. This groundbreaking service, leveraging Singtel’s Next Generation 10GPON (Gigabit Passive Optical Network) technology, follows a successful pilot phase last year. “We promised to provide our customers with the best network innovations and cutting-edge technologies for work and leisure,” said Goh Seow Eng, Managing Director of Home Consumer Singapore at Singtel. “We recognize that residential customers are consuming more bandwidth and need faster speeds for their online activities...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/singtel-increases-maximum-speeds-for-home-office-fibre-broadband/
